a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: int
assumes h0 : "-30 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 26"
shows  "sum x {-30..26} = -114"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the sum of all integers $x$ for which $-30 \leq x \leq 26$ ? The final Answer is -114
 ### Proof
 The sum of all integers $y$ for which $-26\le y\le26$ is 0 since for every negative term there is a positive term of the same absolute value.
 Thus, the sum of all integers $x$ for which $-30\le x\le26$ is $-30-29-28-27=-30\times4+1+2+3=-120+6=\boxed{-114}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: int
assumes h0 : "-30 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 26"
shows  "sum x {-30..26} = -114"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the sum of all integers $x$ from -30 to 26, inclusive. The final answer is -114.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: int and S :: "int set"
assumes h0 : "S = {x. -30 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 26}"
shows  "sum id S = -114"

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
shows  "(\<Sum> x::int. if -30 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 26 then x else 0) = -114"
